confession.devil_appearance: fort hideux, laid et noir (very hideous, ugly and black)
confession.seduction_context: She was out in fields with husband, went off into bushes. Evil one made her renounce God and had intercourse with her. She thought it was her husband as he was warm like him, but as he left told her his name was Abraham. Next harvest they had plentiful grain.

within a few days after first cow

timeline.subject: Ottile femme d'Emerich
timeline.details: Arrested after denunciation by Lutschen Meyete

timeline.subject: Ottile femme d'Emerich
timeline.details: Confronted with Lutschen Meyete who accused her of witchcraft and helping to kill several people and animals

timeline.subject: Ottile femme d'Emerich
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves taking of depositions and interrogation

timeline.subject: Ottile femme d'Emerich
timeline.details: Witness depositions taken from George le Vieu Bergier, Bastien le Bouchier, Anthoine le Potier

timeline.subject: Ottile femme d'Emerich
timeline.details: First interrogation, denied all charges. Followed by confrontations with witnesses

timeline.subject: Ottile femme d'Emerich
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves torture by thumbscrews only unless she appears about to confess

timeline.subject: Ottile femme d'Emerich
timeline.details: First torture session - thumbscrews and strappado. Confessed to seduction by devil named Abraham and bewitching miller's wife

timeline.subject: Ottile femme d'Emerich
timeline.details: Still admitted seduction but denied harm; retracted confession about bewitching miller's wife

timeline.subject: Ottile femme d'Emerich
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence with permission for further torture to obtain information about malefices and accomplices

timeline.subject: Ottile femme d'Emerich
timeline.details: Second torture session - thumbscrews, strappado and rack. Claimed earlier confessions were extorted, persisted in denials throughout

timeline.subject: Ottile femme d'Emerich
timeline.details: Change de Nancy states she can be tortured again because death sentence was not read before second torture

timeline.subject: Ottile femme d'Emerich
timeline.details: Supplementary investigation into noises heard from prison - testimony from Jean Tonnellier

timeline.subject: Ottile femme d'Emerich
timeline.details: Third torture session - thumbscrews, strappado, rack and beinschauben (leg pressing device). Renewed confessions about seduction and bewitching miller's wife, child, and bull

timeline.subject: Ottile femme d'Emerich and Margueritte la Porchiere

timeline.subject: Ottile femme d'Emerich

timeline.subject: Ottile femme d'Emerich

methods: beinschauben (leg pressing device similar to brodequins)

accomplices_named.name: Lutschen Meyete

accomplices_named.name: Margueritte la Porchiere

notable_quotes.speaker: Lutschen Meyete
notable_quotes.french: et quelle est sorciere ayant comise toute meschancetez ensembles que sy elle n'est pareillement chastiée quel en crie vengeance et quelle veut mourir sur ceste accusation
notable_quotes.english: and that she is a witch having committed all mischiefs together, that if she is not likewise punished she cries for vengeance and that she wants to die on this accusation
notable_quotes.context: Meyete's denunciation of Ottile on 27 November 1619

notable_quotes.speaker: Ottile femme d'Emerich
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle ne scavoit comment faire de son sorps et de sa vie
notable_quotes.english: that she did not know what to do with her body and her life
notable_quotes.context: Ottile's distressed statement to Anthoine le Potier when she heard Meyete had accused her

notable_quotes.speaker: George le Vieu Bergier
notable_quotes.french: que ce luy estoit bien faict
notable_quotes.context: What Ottile allegedly said when she passed George after his leg was broken

notable_quotes.speaker: George le Vieu Bergier (reporting Ottile's words)
notable_quotes.french: le diable qu'il la viene querir et qu'il l'emporte
notable_quotes.english: may the devil come get her and carry her away
notable_quotes.context: What Ottile allegedly cried out several times after quarrel with her husband in the fields

notable_quotes.speaker: Emerich (Ottile's husband)
notable_quotes.french: a quoy elle avoit pensé de les ruiner luy et ses enfans
notable_quotes.english: what was she thinking to ruin him and his children
notable_quotes.context: Husband's response when Ottile became distressed upon arrest, her face turning blue

notable_quotes.speaker: Ottile femme d'Emerich
notable_quotes.french: qu'il aille demander advis a Jean Houbet et a Cornelius son beaufrere comme elle debvroit faire
notable_quotes.english: that he should go ask advice from Jean Houbet and Cornelius his brother-in-law about what she should do
notable_quotes.context: Ottile's response to her husband upon arrest

notable_quotes.speaker: Interrogator (in trial record)
notable_quotes.french: Joinct aussy quil ne peut quelles naient quelque affaire et secretes par ensemble veu quelles trois seules estoient ordinairement ensembles et qu'estant separées pour couvrir et pallier laffaire elles detractoient l'une l'autre dequoy lon sest aperceu des quelque temps
notable_quotes.english: Moreover it cannot be that they do not have some business and secrets together seeing that the three of them were ordinarily together and that being separated to cover up and conceal the affair they spoke ill of one another which has been noticed for some time
notable_quotes.context: Question about Ottile, Meyete, and Marguerite's relationship during interrogation on 14 December

notable_quotes.speaker: Ottile femme d'Emerich
notable_quotes.french: Jesus qu'est ce que vous me dit disant encor que je sois assez estrange et mauvaise sy ne suis je sorciere pourtant et ne scay sy jay oncques appele le malin
notable_quotes.english: Jesus what are you saying to me, saying further that although I am strange enough and bad, I am not a witch however and do not know if I have ever called the evil one
notable_quotes.context: Ottile's response to charges from George le Bergier on 14 December

notable_quotes.speaker: Ottile femme d'Emerich (under torture)
notable_quotes.french: quelle ne scavoit que l'on luy dise comme elle doibt dire et quelle le diroit
notable_quotes.english: that she did not know, let them tell her what she should say and she would say it
notable_quotes.context: During first torture session on 31 December 1619 when placed on strappado

notable_quotes.speaker: Ottile femme d'Emerich (under torture)
notable_quotes.french: que ouy que cestoit le diable quelle ne scait quelle diable un noir diable que l'on luy dise comment les diables estoient quelle le diroit autrement quelle ne scavoit rien et n'avoit faict aucun mal
notable_quotes.english: that yes it was the devil, she does not know what devil, a black devil, let them tell her what devils were like and she would say it, otherwise she knew nothing and had done no harm
notable_quotes.context: Confused confession under torture on 31 December 1619

notable_quotes.speaker: Ottile femme d'Emerich
notable_quotes.french: que sy elle y a esté qu'il faut que les autres l'ayant aveuglée et menée avec elles, et que le malin l'a esgarée quelle n'a rien de bon en elle
notable_quotes.english: that if she was there, it must be that the others blinded her and led her with them, and that the evil one misled her, she has nothing good in her
notable_quotes.context: Confession under torture on 31 December about alleged participation in witchcraft

notable_quotes.speaker: Ottile femme d'Emerich
notable_quotes.french: parce quelle l'auroit amiellée de bonne parolle, jusques a tant quelle l'auroit desbauchée et rendue sorciere comme elle
notable_quotes.english: because she would have enticed her with good words, until she would have debauched her and made her a witch like herself
notable_quotes.context: Naming Margueritte la Porchiere as cause of her ruin on 29 January 1620 under torture

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial shows extensive use of torture over multiple sessions (31 Dec 1619, 16 Jan 1620, 29 Jan 1620) with confessions obtained only under extreme duress. Ottile consistently retracted confessions when not under torture. Notable legal procedural issue: death sentence not read before second torture, requiring court authorization for third session. Trial reveals network of three women (Ottile, Lutschen Meyete, Margueritte la Porchiere) accused together. Economic tensions evident in dispute over cow sale. Prison conditions described as extremely cold. Evidence includes testimony about noises/voices in prison suggesting possible demonic visitation or hallucination. Total trial duration 83 days from arrest to execution. Costs initially assessed at 212 francs, later reduced to 175 francs by Chambre des Comptes in May 1622.
